Adult/immature.description: Laysan Albatrosses have a white head and underparts, and variable white in the underside of the wing; Black-footed Albatrosses are mostly brown.

Immature.description: Short-tailed Albatross has a very large, pink bill, whereas Black-footed Albatross has a smaller, dark bill and a pale patch on the face.

Adult/immature.description: Sooty Shearwaters are much smaller than Black-footed Albatross, with much quicker, shallower wingbeats and a smaller and more slender bill.

Dark morph.description: Northern Fulmars are much smaller than Black-footed Albatrosses, with a much shorter bill and a prominent "tubenose."
